tachyon.worker.block

Class BlockLockManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.worker.block.BlockLockManager

  • public final class BlockLockManager
extends Object
    Handle all block locks.

    This class is thread-safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BlockLockManager()

    • Method Detail

      • blockHashIndex

        public static int blockHashIndex(long blockId)
        Gets index of the lock that will be used to lock the block
        Parameters:
        blockId - the id of the block
        Returns:
        hash index of the lock

      • lockBlock

        public long lockBlock(long sessionId,
             long blockId,
             BlockLockType blockLockType)
        Locks a block. Note that, lock striping is used so even this block does not exist, a lock id is still returned.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the ID of session
        blockId - the ID of block
        blockLockType - READ or WRITE
        Returns:
        lock ID

      • unlockBlock

        public void unlockBlock(long lockId)
                 throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Releases a lock by its lockId or throws BlockDoesNotExistException.
        Parameters:
        lockId - the ID of the lock
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if no lock is associated with this lock id

      • unlockBlock

        public void unlockBlock(long sessionId,
               long blockId)
                 throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException

      • validateLock

        public void validateLock(long sessionId,
                long blockId,
                long lockId)
                  throws BlockDoesNotExistException,
                         InvalidWorkerStateException
        Validates the lock is hold by the given session for the given block.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The ID of the session
        blockId - The ID of the block
        lockId - The ID of the lock
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - when no lock record can be found for lockId
        InvalidWorkerStateException - when sessionId or blockId is not consistent with that in the lock record for lockId

      • cleanupSession

        public void cleanupSession(long sessionId)
        Cleans up the locks currently hold by a specific session
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the ID of the session to cleanup

      • getLockedBlocks

        public Set<Long> getLockedBlocks()
        Get a set of currently locked blocks.
        Returns:
        a set of locked blocks
